channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Generally overgrown tree branches from the south side of Hayes Lane between the junction with Scotts Lane and the Chinese Roundabout (jct Wickham Way) with twigs scratching the side of the new 358 £700,000 electric buses and other large vehicles., 11th February
item.description:
Generally overgrown tree branches from the south side of Hayes Lane between the junction with Scotts Lane and the Chinese Roundabout (jct Wickham Way) with twigs scratching the side of the new 358 £700,000 electric buses and other large vehicles. Some highway signs (eg. roundabout ahead) are hidden within this vegetation. Now in bare branches and before the bird nesting season would be a good time to prune the trees and woody shrubs. It is unclear to me whether this is a council highway verge (probably) or the rear entrance / rear fence curtilage of maybe 30 houses in Hayes Way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road cracked and crumbling, 11th February
item.description:
Cracked and crumbling road surface in various places outside sainsburys and old bike project shop, near intersection. Resurfacing required
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, Camberwell Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Outside school at no 180 Willesden Lane by the kerb, 11th February
item.description:
Good afternoon I previously reported these three big potholes by the kerbside under ref no: 8790651 but I was told they could not be found despite their size because no number address had been given My apologies They are by the kerb outside the school at number 180 Willesden Lane Hoping that these three potholes can now be located and repaired Many thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorbikes and scooter using a footbath, 11th February
item.description:
Motorbike and scooter often use the top of green Dale to cut through to blanchdowne to champion Hill (and vice versa). Has been going on for years but is getting worse. Motorised vehicles are banned from the road but happen often and poses a threat to pedestrians and cyclists. Please can you install a cctv camera to monitor and enforce.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Dale, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Poo and Bags, 11th February
item.description:
Someone keeps leaving dog poo bags on the pavement outside the KS1 gate to Balgowan, as well as dog poo on the pavements. Utterly disgusting and needs cleaning before the kids walk it into school
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balgowan Road, Beckenham, Greater London
